Manx: Mannin ayns yn Cheayn.
English: The Isle of Man in the Sea
Diplomatic: Mannin ayns yn cheayn

Manx: My ellan veg ass shilley sooill,
English: My little island out of eyesight,
Diplomatic: My ellan veg ass shilley sooil

Manx: Ayns mean yn aarkey soie,
English: Situated in the middle of the ocean,
Diplomatic: Ayns mean yn aarkey soie

Manx: Ta faagit nish foddey my chooyl,
English: That is now left far behind me,
Diplomatic: Ta faagyt nish foddey my chooyl

Manx: Yn keayn mygeayrt-e-mooee.
English: The sea surrounding her.
Diplomatic: Yn cheayn mygeayrt y mooie

Manx: Cha voddym cur my-ner ny smoo,
English: I can no more behold,
Diplomatic: Cha voddym curmerner ny smoo

Manx: Raad va mish cliaghtey cloie,
English: Where I used to play,
Diplomatic: Raad va mish claghtey cloie

Manx: Ga yeearree nish dy akin ee,
English: Although now yearning to see her,
Diplomatic: Gha yeerree nish dy aakin shee

Manx: As er Cronk Veayl dy hoie.
English: As sit on Cronk Meayl.
Diplomatic: As er cronk vule dy hoie

Manx: Agh ta mee nish feer foddey jeh,
English: But I am now very far off,
Diplomatic: Agh ta mee nish feer foddey jeh

Manx: As rouail noon as noal,
English: And wandering to and fro,
Diplomatic: As rouaill noon as noal

Manx: S’liauyr ta mish gennaghtyn yn traa,
English: How long I feel the time,
Diplomatic: Slouyr ta mish gennaghtyn yn tra

Manx: Cha foddey veih my oayl.
English: So far from where I belong.
Diplomatic: Cha foddey veih my oayll

Manx: Ny croink raad va mee cliaghtey shooyl,
English: The hills where I used to walk,
Diplomatic: Ny croink raad va mee claghtey shooyl

Manx: Fud pusheeyn connee,
English: Through heather flowers,
Diplomatic: Fud pusheeyn connee

Manx: Er Cronk-ny-Arrey as Cronk Veayl
English: On Cronk-ny-Arrey and Cronk Veayl,
Diplomatic: Er cronk ny arrey as cronk vule

Manx: Vaegh mennick gerjagh mee.
English: That would often cheer me up.
Diplomatic: Vagh mennick gerjagh mee

Manx: Agh ta ny laghyn shen ec kione,
English: But those days are ended,
Diplomatic: Agh ta ny laaghyhn shen eck kione

Manx: As ta mish shenn as lheeah,
English: And I am old and grey,
Diplomatic: As ta mish shen as lheay

Manx: As nish myr adam as e chloan,
English: And now like Adam and his children,
Diplomatic: As nish myr adam as y chloan

Manx: Beem’s jarroodit dy leah.
English: I’ll soon be forgotten.
Diplomatic: Beems jarroodyt dy lheay

Manx: Slane ayd, slane ayd, my Ellan veg,
English: Farewell, farewell my little Island,
Diplomatic: Slane ayd slane ayd my Ellan veg

Manx: Cha vaikym oo dy bra,
English: I will not see you anymore,
Diplomatic: Cha vaik ym OO dy bra

Manx: Ny shooyl mygeayrt reesht er y chreg,
English: Or walk around again on the rock,
Diplomatic: Ny shooyl mygeayrt reesht er y chreg

Manx: Raad cheau mee wheesh dy hraa.
English: Where I spent so much time
Diplomatic: Raad cheau me wheesh dy chra

Manx: Slane eu, Slane eu, my chaarjyn nish,
English: Farewell, farewell my friends now,
Diplomatic: Slane eu Slane eu my charjyn nish

Manx: Cummal ayns Mannin veen
English: Living in dear Mannin,
Diplomatic: Commal ayns Mannin veen

Manx: Yn ellan veg raad ruggyr mish
English: The little Island where I was born,
Diplomatic: Yn Ellan veg raad ruggyr mish

Manx: Faagit ayns mean y cheayn
English: Left in the middle of the sea.
Diplomatic: Faaigyt ayns mean y cheayn

Manx: Ny yeih cha vel mish coayl my chree,
English: Yet, I do not lose my heart,
Diplomatic: Ny yeih cha vel mish cooal my chree

Manx: Ny keayney er-dty-hon,
English: Or weep for you,
Diplomatic: Ny keaney er dy hon

Manx: Son leah bee’m currit sheese ayns shee,
English: For soon I will be laid down in peace,
Diplomatic: Son lheay beem curryt sheesh ayns shee

Manx: Dy chadley ayns y joan.
English: To sleep in the dust.
Diplomatic: Dy chadley ayns y joan

Manx: Raad nagh vel seaghyn ny tranlaase,
English: Where there is no sorrow or oppression,
Diplomatic: Raad nagh vel seaghyn ny tranlaase

Manx: Ny pooishee sowrey ayn.
English: Or summer flower.
Diplomatic: Ny pushie sowry ayn

Manx: Ny lhie ayns oghrish yn vaase,
English: Lying in the bosom of death,
Diplomatic: Ny lhie ayns ockerish yn vaase

Manx: Myr adam as y chloan.
English: Like Adam and his children.
Diplomatic: Myr adam as y chloan

Manx: E Faragher.
English: E Faragher.
Diplomatic: E Faragher.
